WRITING.TEXT: Thank you! I really love the contrast, I usually stick to one color but this adds some visual interest.

-FACE: Bareminerals liquid in bare tan
Too Faced concealer (discontinued) in Honey
BH Cosmetics Blush Contour Set, used w/ very light hand
-EYES: NYX milk (base), set with noble from KvD 2015 Palette
Analouge and Vox on top (KvD LD 20-5 palette)
Colourpop's Prance Liner , with Synth eyeshadow on top from same palette used above KvD Ink Liner in Trooper
Just some random mascara
Brows: Just some old Urban Decay eyeshadow, nothing special
-LIPS: NYX Lip Cream in Sable

WRITING.TITLE: Testing a Blue + Orange Look with Rarely Used Makeup!

WRITING.TEXT: To be fair, even the cake on the original is pretty hideous looking.
OOOH SAVAGE NO CHILL BRUH FR
Nothing pains me more than seeing beautiful colors but knowing they'll look bad on my skin tone...
holy crap, mr. blonde looked so great on you! i wish i had the skin tone to pull off cool colors

Opiate: Jerk-Off. I ususlly don't like really angry music, but this one has some of the best guitar I've ever heard in a song.
Undertow: 4 Degrees. I can't for the life of me understand why this song isn't more popular. The vocals are so eerie and suck you in. I think it is a great, grimey song that is a great example of what the album is all about.
nima: H. This song really makes me emotional, though I can't pinpoint why. I think it has many interpretations; in my case, it has to do with my depression and eating disorder. Very powerful, and never gets repetitive.
Lateralus: Triad. Just a great song to zone out to. Used when I want to be in my own little world for a few minutes.
10,000 Days: The Pot. I LOVE songs about hypocrisy. This is the anthem to calling people out.
The zooming in and out on Carson and Trump msde this moment yet more confusing.

"Age doesn't matter"
shows two people of the same/similar age
???

I absolutely love the ulta matte lipstick colors, but my lips are very dry to begin with...they look like sandpaper with their liquid lipsticks on. Anyone know of some dupes (cruelty-free if possible)?

Honestly, I saw this comment after reading some fan comments on a forum. I am a huge fan of Tool, but don't use any mild-altering drugs. It's very annoying to have other Tool enthusiasts tell me I "wouldn't understand" the underlying meaning of a song because I have never taken LSD/shrooms/etc.

My favorite primer is colourpop's own primer, it's very nice and clings onto the color (in a good way). I can't wear the liquid ones though...my lip cracks like the ground during an earthquake. The matte solid lipsticks are much better IMO, although they arent transfer-proof.

Funny, I usually see blending as my major weakness. I have an extra fold of skin that gives the illusion of 2 eyelid creases, which may contribute to it usually looking unblended (can't see the gradient). That's why I usually take pictures with my eyebrows slightly raised...
Thanks dude! I'm trying to venture out from my usual taupe and tan eyeshadows.
Thank you so much!

Face: Too Faced Primed and Poreless Primer Bareminerals Liquid Foundation in Bare Tan NYX Baked Blush (I don't remember what color, it is a muted darker pink)
Eyes: NYX Liquid Eyeliner (It's has an awful applicator- do not recommend) Kat Von D Lock-it Eye Primer Lime Crime Venus Palette (I do NOT endorse this brand...but ai already have the palette, so I'll continue to use it)
Brows: A matte dark brown eyeshadow from UD. It was part of the limited edition Pulp Fiction Palette.
Lips: Colourpop's Grunge Lipstick (no primer this time-whoops)
So far this year they haven't played any Intolerance songs, but strangely enough they play some Opiate. Weird.
I have straight lashes too, but I find that tightlining your upper lid helps them appear thicker. some mascara on the lower lashes gices more to the eyes depth too!

I love the blush placement, very natural! I love the eye color, but I agree that the inner corner highlight is a bit too strong. I would also suggest going softer on the nose contour, or at least blending more...I can see the "line," if that makes sense.

I feel torn about this. I was born in 1998, so have never been able to see Tool in concert. As Undertow is possibly my favorite album of all time, I'd love to see them play Intolerance or Flood.
That being said, an artist shouldn't regress back into those negative thoughts if they find doing so unhelpful. It is the members' (specifically Maynard's) decision; he doesn't owe us fans. So while it's sad to realize I'll never hear Jerk-Off live, I look forward to hopefully hearing other amazing, more positive songs. There are so many to choose from!
I don't know if I've ever been more envious in my life
Dreaming of an eyeshadow palette...Kat von D's dramatic colors with the silkiness of Too Faced shadows. One can dream, these are my two davorite brands, yet have very different aesthetics.
Oh, how I wish...thanks!

Primer: Too Faced Primed Poreless
Foundation: Bareminerals liquid foundation in "Bare Tan"
Brows: "Vengeance" from Urban Decay's limited edition Pulp Fiction palette
Eye Primer: Kat Von D High Voltage Eye Primer
Eyeshadows: this tutorial's colors, with a few adjustments for my skin tone http://youtu.be/3Gkz9OJfvxc
Lipstick: Milani in "Matte Beauty"
thanks! i'm getting into warmer colors, they help my skin look less yellow (i'm half mexican so my winter complexion has a lot of yellow undertones)
There's a lot I would do differently next time...not bring the orange up so high, more intensity on the lid, wear false lashes maybe...but overall I liked this look.

WRITING.TITLE: A Jkissa-inspired orange look. First time wearing non-nude eyeshadow in public.

WRITING.TEXT: Sorry for the low quality picture, snapchat was my best option as of the time. The crease is usually there, though sometimes more prominently than pther times. It's really unnactractive and makes doing eyeshadow difficult.
oh how i wish it were so...
i guess that's reassuring...i definately have worse pictures, but i lost them on my old imac.
i have extremely thick wavy hair that is hard to style, so whenever it looks good i feel the need to document it with a picture, heheh.

WRITING.TITLE: 7th grade -12th. I hope this trend continues...

WRITING.TEXT: Yeah, it's very complicated for me to understand, much less explain. I am looking at 6 or so other places, only Target has responded. Thank you anyways.

I called HR to check what times it said I was available. Originally (on the website application) I put availibility as 7:30-9:30. When I went to the 2nd interview I said I forgot I had practice and gave a much more limited schedule. The interviewer wrote it down but I guess it was never changed on the official system. So the manager has one set of info while the databate has another! It's very confusing and stressful.

cool. i tried to edit my schedule on the site but it wouldn't let me. a friend told me to contact human resources, but i'm not sure where to find that information/number. do you know by any chance where one can find it?

WRITING.TITLE: Can I reapply for cashier?
WRITING.TEXT:
Hello /r/Target! About a month gfo, I applied for cashier at my local Target. I was called for an interview almost immediately. After the first, I was promptly asked to go in for a second. Sadly, this is where I feel I made my mistake. As I was in track and school during that time, my flexibility was...pretty bad 5:30-10 on school days). I was not given the job ultimately. Though no reason was given, I have a feeling that was why. Now track is over, summer break is a few weeks away (June 5th), and my schedule is MUCH more open. My friend who works there says the store is low on cashiers and I should reapply. Is this allowed or a good idea? I've wanted to work there for a long time!
Many thanks for reading and responding!

WRITING.TITLE: Severe Race Anxiety [Help]
WRITING.TEXT:
hello, first time posting at /r/anxiety !
i have been in sports for my entire life, mostly soccer. i found i enjoy more individual activities, such as swimming and running. unfortunately, i hate competing. as in, i dropped out of my swim team when i was doing well because i hated the pressure. this year, i have joined track for the second year. i've never been particularly athletic (although i'm not the absolute worst), but i enjoy running long distance. my coach keeps telling me to compete, but i continue to make excuses on why i can't. i want to be honest and tell him i have severe anxiety disorder and can't sleep for days on end when i know a meet is coming up. does anyone know of a way i could approach my coach? i don't want if to come off as me being a slacker...i love training and work hard every day, but races ruin the fun completely.
